title: The Disappearing Euro
content:
The Disappearing Euro   
   
I'm currently in the final testing stages of a new typeface created in Fontlab 4.5.1. It's postscript Type 1 set to Imported encoding. When I test strings of text in InDesign 2.0 any instance of the Euro or Apple symbol are left blank. Is this a standard for InDesign? Or is this on my end?   
   
Of course the symbol can be inserted via Insert Glyphs but not with a keystroke. Using my system True Type fonts the Euro and Apple do however show up without using Insert Glyphs.   
   
Anyone have experience with this?
author: eolson

comments.content:
I'll rephrase...   
Does the Euro show up for everyone while using postscript fonts and InDesign 2.0?
